reviews.review_msg: I went to office hours. He told me I wasn't intelligent enough for university and should go to trade school. I was on the Dean's List during my undergrad, and am doing a PhD. His class was damaging. By the end of the semester, he dehumanized me and undermined my sense of capacity so badly that I almost left university without finishing my degree.
Best prof for Philosophy. Just take his class. Do not question this decision.

This is the style of pedagogy that you never walk away from unchanged and unimproved - even if you do nothing the entire semester, Nic will let you know that thinking is an important part of life. It is in Nic's class that I learned another level of analytical reading, writing and most importantly - thinking; an integral piece in quality education.

Nic is an funny, caring, and an overall excellent lecturer. He gives great feedback on assignments and has an high-capacity for relaying information from the readings. I would love to take more classes with him.
He could never show me why my arguements against the topic of the week were wrong.

Professor Andersen is really disappointing. Her lectures are confusing, and it feels like she doesn't take the time to explain things clearly. When I asked for help, she seemed impatient and didn't give useful feedback on assignments. It's been a struggle to stay engaged in her class. Wouldn't recommend.

The readings are really obscure and difficult to parse. Had to spend several hours trying to make sense of obscure papers in this class. My grades in other classes suffered as a result. Holly is not helpful at all

So many readings and the lectures are pretty useless. The professor is very demanding, goes on so many tangents and wants to cover a lot of material within the course. The pace of the course is too fast, making it difficult to keep up.

Holly is passionate to a fault. Expects students to spend too much time on her classes. We have students struggling with cost of living and then there are professors like Holly who expect that students cam devote all waking hours to academics. Some of us need to work through college. Such an elitist snob.

I would 100% take another class with Holly. She made a hard course so enjoyable. Even tho science is not my strong suit by any means, I thoroughly enjoyed this class. She made two hour lectures go by so quickly! Holly is also a very fair marker! This class had 2 papers and weekly in-class writings that were not hard at all.

Holly is a good professor, but she is almost passionate to a fault. She tends to go on tangents in lectures that can be useful if you really understand the course content, but if Philosophy of Science is not your thing, it can further complicate matters. Also, the readings are difficult so be prepared for that. However, Holly gives great feedback.
Holly is great at explaining complex concepts. She also provides detailed feedbacks in her office hours.

Dr. Andersen is really really great. Her passion is infectious and she clearly cares a lot about not only sharing the course content with her students but also about ensuring that everyone is following along. Phil of sci isn't really my fav area of phil so I was at times a bit lost but that wasn't her fault and really tries to keep people engaged.

Holly is passionate about this subject to a fault, she frequently assigns way too much assignment and work, and expects too much. She has very poor time management, trying to cram a 2h lecture into 1h. She has incredibly high expectations, as if this is a Masters level. She isn't a bad person, just deeply unaware of how overwhelming her class is.

Prof Andersen is such a great professor, I had to take PHIL341 as 'Science of Philosophy', and it was honestly one of the hardest Philosophy courses I have taken (lots of content), but the prof made it much more interesting. She's very enthusiastic on the subject and is nice. Definitely recommed her as a prof if you get the opportunity.

Holly is an amazing professor! She is incredibly knowledgable about the subject matter and puts together a great reading list. She really encourages student discussion and gives great feedback. If she has a reputation for being tough it is only because she really wants her students to do well and pushes them to do well.

Holly is one of the best professors of Philosphy at SFU. She is incredibly precise and clear with her explanations and uses the relevant texts very well (you never feel like you've wasted money). Downside: She's a super tough marker. Be prepared to receive lower paper marks than you are used to. Also: Participate! She loves students who speak up.
